intro: Sisyrinchium oreophilum, commonly known as the mountain blue-eyed grass, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces delicate blue to violet flowers in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. Its compact size and vibrant color make it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
